Generation I.Red: A carnivorous Pok é mon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: A carnivorous Pok é mon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.
Generation I.Yellow: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny insects with its vines and devours them.
Generation I.Stadium: A kind of bug-eating plant that hunts small insects. It uses its roots as feet for walking.

Generation II.Gold: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
Generation II.Silver: It plants its feet deep underground to replenish water. It can't escape its enemy while it's rooted.
Generation II.Crystal: If it notices anything that moves, it immediately flings its vine at the object.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It plants its feet deep underground to replenish water. It can't escape its enemy while it's rooted. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Bellsprout 's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pok é mon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
Generation III.Sapphire: Bellsprout 's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pok é mon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
Generation III.Emerald: A Bellsprout 's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, it leaks a fluid that melts even iron.
Generation III.FireRed: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.
Generation III.LeafGreen: A carnivorous Pok é mon that traps and eats bugs. It appears to use its root feet to replenish moisture.

Generation IV.Diamond: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It plants its feet deep underground to replenish water. It can't escape its enemy while it's rooted.

Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

Generation IX.Scarlet: No matter what Bellsprout is doing, if it detects movement nearby, it will immediately react by reaching out with its thin vines.
Generation IX.Violet: It plants its feet deep underground to rehydrate itself. While doing so, it's unable to run away if it's attacked.

Generation III.LeafGreen: Routes 5 , 6 , 7 , 12 , 13 , 14 , 15 , 24 , and 25 , Berry Forest , Bond Bridge , Cape Brink , Water Path

Generation IV.HeartGold: Routes 5 , 6 , 24 , 25 , 31 , 32 , and 44 Safari Zone (Forest, default; Wasteland with 3 Forest points)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Routes 5 , 6 , 24 , 25 , 31 , 32 , and 44 Safari Zone (Forest, default; Wasteland with 3 Forest points)

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Routes 229 and 230 Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Swampy Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Sunlit Cavern , Bogsunk Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Routes 229 and 230 Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Swampy Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Sunlit Cavern , Bogsunk Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Kitakami Road , Apple Hills , Loyalty Plaza , Mossfell Confluence Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
